intro: Heppiella parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered heppiella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to them. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. Heppiella parviflora is often found in moist, sunny habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
